credits.writtenBy: Michael Borkow, Mike Sikowitz & Jeffrey Astrof

note: {Transcriber’s Note: This is an hour-long special episode. Which means that the first part of this episode is episode 212. The second part of this episode is episode 213. Since episodes 212 and 213 are combined into one file, that’s why there is no episode 213 in the season 2 table of contents and the numbers jump from episode 212 to 214.}

content.text: [A guy is sitting at his desk and his boss comes in and drops a huge pile of papers on his desk. The guy looks dejected.]

content.speaker: Commercial Voiceover
content.text: Can’t get the monkey off your back? Then put it in your mouth…
[A monkey jumps on the desk and hands the guy a beer. He opens the beer and is suddenly on the beach, in a hammock, with beautiful women all around.]

content.speaker: Commercial Voiceover
content.text: …With MonkeyShine Beer. [MonkeyShine theme] MonkeyShine Beer, ’cause it’s a jungle out there.]
[Camera pans back from the TV to show the gang watching.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That commercial always makes me so sad.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, but then the guy opens his beer and those girls run at him, so, everything seems to work out OK.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I meant because the monkey in it reminds me of Marcel.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can see that, ’cause they both have those big brown eyes and, ya know, the little pouty chin. Monica: And the fact that they’re both monkeys.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sometimes I wonder if I did the right thing, ya know, giving him away.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Ross, you had to, I mean, he was humping everything in sight. I mean, I have a Malibu Barbi that will no longer be wearing white to her wedding.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Remember when sometimes he’d borrow your hat, and, and when you got it back there’d be little monkey raisins in it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well sure, when he did it, it was funny. When I did it to my boss’s hat… all of the sudden I have this big attitude problem.

content.description: Central Perk. Chandler, Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe are at the couch.

content.text: [Joey enters holding a letter]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, hey, check it out, guess what I got.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Rhythm?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, my first fan mail.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Alright!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [reading] ’dear Dr. Remore, know that I love you and would do anything to have you.’ Gosh. ‘Your not-so-secretive admirer, Erica Ford.’ Ooh wait, ‘PS enclosed please find 14 of my eyelashes.’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ya know, in crazy world, that means you’re married.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This wasn’t addressed to Days of Our Lives , this is, this came to your apartment. There’s no stamp on it, this woman was in our building.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my god, I got my very own stalker.
[Ross enters with a suitcase]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey guys.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, where are you off to, Travelin’ Jake?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, there’s this, uh, paleontology conference in L.A. so I figured I’d go and then drive down to the zoo and surprise Marcel.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know I think he will be surprised, ’till he realizes he’s a monkey, and uh, you know, isn’t capable of that emotion.
[Rob (Chris Isaac) enters]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Phoebe, that really cute guy is here again.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, oh, OK, so everyone, pretend like I’m telling you a story, OK. And, and it’s really funny. So everyone just laugh, now.
[Everyone laughs]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, I know. [to Rob] Hello.

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: Hi. I’m Rob Dohnen.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi Rob Dohnen.

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: I don’t know anything about music, but I think you’re really, really great.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, wow.

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: Anyway, I schedule performers for the childrens libraries around the city and I was just thinking, have you ever thought about playing your songs for kids?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I would love to have kids… you’re, you’re the, you’re, me play the songs that I will write for them.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Chandler and Joey are standing around in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, whaddya wanna do for dinner?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well we could just stay in and cook for ourselves. [both laugh hysterically]
[door buzzer goes off]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: It’s Erica.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, the stalker.

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Never mind, it’s open.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [Joey grabs a frying pan] Yes, hitting her with a frying pan’s a good idea. We might wanna have a backup plan, though, just in case she isn’t a cartoon.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Let’s get out of here.
[They run out and knock on Monica and Rachel’s door]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The one time they’re not home.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: OK, we’ll just leave, and when we pass her on the stairs, she won’t know it’s me ’cause we’ve never met.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s how radio stars escape stalkers.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She’s comin’.
[Both run back in their apartment. There’s a knock at the door.]

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: It’s me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, this is it, this is how we’re gonna die. Ready?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait, wait, wait. [Opens the top of the dish soap he’s holding]
[Joey opens the door and sees Erica (Brooke Shields). Joey gets a huge smile and Chandler squeezed the dish soap in the air.]

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Erica.

content.description: San Diego Zoo. Ross is at the Monkey cages.

content.speaker: Lipson
content.text: Hi, Dean Lipson, zoo administrator. I was told you had a question.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I uh, I can’t seem to find the monkey I donated last year. He’s a capuchan, answers to the name Marcel.

content.speaker: Lipson
content.text: Ahh, I’m afraid I have some bad news. Marcel has passed on.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God, what happened?

content.speaker: Lipson
content.text: Well he got sick, and then he got sicker, and then he got a little better but then he died.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe this.

content.speaker: Lipson
content.text: I’m sorry Mr. Geller. But ya know, there’s an old saying, ’sometimes monkeys die.’ It’s not a great saying but it certainly is fitting today.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, ya know, someone should have called me.

content.speaker: Lipson
content.text: I’m sorry. Look, I know this can’t bring him back but here, it’s just a gesture.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Zoo dollars?

content.speaker: Lipson
content.text: Yes, and come see the bird show at 4. The macaws wear hats. Well it’s a lot cuter if your monkey hasn’t just died.

content.description: Library. Phoebe is getting ready to sing for the kids. Chandler, Monica, and Rachel are there.

content.text: [Phoebe pulls out her guitar]

content.speaker: Kids
content.text: Ooohhh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe Joey’s having lunch with his stalker. What i-, what is she like.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you remember Cathy Bates in Misery ?

content.speaker: Rachel AND Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, she looks the exact opposite of that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And she’s not crazy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no no no, she’s a total wack job. Yeah, she thinks that Joey is actually Dr. Drake Remore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ah, and I mean, he’s going out with her? He can not persue this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, just because this woman thinks she can actually see Joey through the magical box in her living room doesn’t mean she’s not a person. I mean, does she not deserve happiness, does she not deserve love? What’re you lookin’ at me for? He’s the one who wants to boff the maniac.

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: You OK?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, uh-uh, I’m just, I’m nervous. So, you know what, maybe if I just, if I picture them all in their underwear.

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: That’s not a good idea, that’s kinda the reason the last guy got fired.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m just, I’m, I’m, I’m used to playing for grown-ups. Ya know, they just, grown-ups drink their coffee and do their grown-up thing, ya know, and kids listen. This is a huge responsibility. What? Are you gonna kiss me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was thinkin’ about it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK. [they kiss] OK, alrighty, let’s play some tunes. Hi everybody, I’m Phoebe

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, um, I’m gonna play, um, some songs about grandparents, OK. [singing] Now, grandma’s a person who everyone likes, she bought you a train and a bright, shiny bike. But lately she hasn’t been coming to dinner, And last time you saw her she looked so much thinner. Now, your mom and your dad said she moved to Peru, but the truth is she died and some day you will too. La-la-la la la-la-la la la-la-la la…

content.description: A nice restraunt. Joey and Erica are dining.

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Oh, Drake, isn’t it amazing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah it is… what?

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Well, here we sit, devil may care, just a little while ago you were reattaching someone’s spinal cord.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, that was a tricky one. In reality, that operation takes like, over 10 hours, but they only showed it for 2 minites.

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Who’s they?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No one.

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Oh Drake, you are so talented, let me see those hands. Oh these hands, these beautiful hands, oh I could just eat them… but I won’t.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good, otherwise my watch would fall off. [laughs hysterically]

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: No, seriously. These hands. These miracle, magical, life-giving hands. Oh, just to be near them, touch them, maybe even lick one?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, just one. [she licks his hands rather emphatically] Wow, you’re good at that.
[Some guy at another table starts choking]

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Oh my God! Someone, he’s choking. Is anyone here a doctor?

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Well, yes, yes, the best doctor in all of Salem, Dr. Drake Remore.

content.description: San Diege Zoo. Ross is still at the monkey cages. A janitor is sweeping.

content.speaker: Janitor
content.text: Meet me in the nocturnal house in 15 minutes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uhh, hey look, I don’t really enjoy being with other men that way. But, um, zoo dollars?

content.speaker: Janitor
content.text: It’s about your monkey. It’s alive.

content.description: Restraunt. Joey and Erica are still there.

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: I don’t understand, why didn’t you help that man?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, cause, uhh, I’m a neurosurgeon and that was clearly a case of, uh, uh, foodal chokage. Alright, look, I got to tell you something.

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: No, no no no, you don’t have to tell me anything. You don’t have to explain yourself to me. Ooh, who am I to question the great Dr. Drake Remore?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But that’s what…

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: I should just be happy to be near you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey I- [she cuts him off with a kiss]

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Hey what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s it, just hey. Like at the end of a dance, HEY! [she starts nibbling his hand] Hey. He-hey.

content.description: Library. Phoebe is singing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [singing] There’ll be times when you get older when you’ll want to sleep with people just to make them like you… But don’t. Cause that’s another thing that you don’t wanna do, everybody That’s another thing that you don’t wanna do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Excellent!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Very informative!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Not at all inappropriate!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you for coming everybody. There’re cookies in the back.

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: That was great, the kids loved you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yay, I rock.

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: And you know why? Because you told the truth, and nobody ever tells kids the truth.You were incredible.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But.

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: How did you know there was a but?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I sense these things. It was either but or butter.

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: The thing is, I think some of the parents, they were kinda hopin’ that you’d play more songs about like, barnyard animals.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can do that.

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: Because that would be fantastic. What? You wanna kiss me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thinkin’ about it.

content.description: San Diego Zoo. Ross and the janitor are in the nocturnal house.

content.speaker: Janitor
content.text: Ahh, the bat. Ambassador of darkness, flitting out of his cave like a winged messenger, sightless spectre of the macabe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Buddy, my monkey?

content.speaker: Janitor
content.text: Oh, yeah, right. There was a break-in, few months back, inside job. Your monkey was taken.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God. But the zoo told me that my monkey was dead.

content.speaker: Janitor
content.text: The zoo! Do you believe everything the zoo tells ya?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That, that’s the only thing the zoo’s ever told me.

content.speaker: Janitor
content.text: Of course they’re gonna say he’s dead. They don’t want the bad publicity. It’s all a great big cover-up. Do you have any idea how high up this thing goes?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That guy Lipson?

content.speaker: Janitor
content.text: Lipson knows. Do you have any idea who else knows?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I, I only know Lipson.

content.speaker: Janitor
content.text: Hmm, Lipson knows huh? Ahh, hello Mr. Opossum, enigma of the trees, upside-down denizen of the night, taunting gravity with…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Buddy, my monkey, my monkey.

content.speaker: Janitor
content.text: Word on the street - well, when I say street, I mean those little pretend streets they have here at the zoo.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course.

content.speaker: Janitor
content.text: Your monkey found a new career, in the entertainment field. That’s all I know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is unbelievable.

content.speaker: Janitor
content.text: So, what is this information worth to you, my friend?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you trying to get me to bribe you?

content.speaker: Janitor
content.text: Maybe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But you already told me everything.

content.description: Library. Ross show up with a MonkeyShine Beer poster.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Check it out, he actually is the MonkeyShine monkey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, so what’re you gonna do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I guess I’m gonna call the beer company and try to find out where he is.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s what I did when I lost my Clydesdales.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, hi again.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Today we’re gonna start with some songs about barnyard animals.
[singing] Oh, the cow in the meadow goes moo, Oh, the cow in the meadow goes moo. Then the farmer hits him on the head and grinds him up, And that’s how we get hamburgers. Nooowww, chickens!

content.description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Monica, Rachel, and the guys are watching Days of Our Lives.]

content.speaker: TV Doctor
content.text: You’re the only one who can save her Drake.

content.speaker: Joey ON TV
content.text: Damnit, I’m a doctor, I’m not God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, there goes my whole belief system.
[knock at the door]

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: It’s Erica.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God, quick turn off the TV.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No no no, wait, I wanna see what happens.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, I get Leslie out of the coma and then we make out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well how can that be, you were just kissing Sabrina?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, it’s a world where Joey is a neuro-surgeon.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Erica, c’mon in.

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: How did you get here so fast, I just saw you in Salem?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right, they uh, they choppered me in. What’s up?

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Ohh, and I see you’re having a little party too. Is she here, huh, huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Sabrina. I know about you two. I saw you today kissing in the doctor’s lounge.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s not what you think, that was…

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: You told me I was the only one. [throws a glass of water in his face]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright look, that’s it. I don’t think we should see each other anymore, alright. Look, I know I should have told you this a long time ago but I am not Drake Remore, OK. I’m not even a doctor, I’m an actor. I just pretend to be a doctor.

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Oh my God. Do the people at the hospital know about this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Somebody wanna help me out here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I know, I know. [Turns on the TV. Joey in on it.]

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: How, how can you be here and there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: ’Cause it’s a television show.

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Drake, what’re you getting at?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m not Drake.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right, he’s not Drake, he’s Hans Remore, Drake’s evil twin.

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Is this true?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, yes it is true. And I know this because, because he pretended to be Drake to, to sleep with me. [throws water in his face]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And then he told me he would run away with me, and he didn’t. [throws water in his face]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And you left the toilet seat up, you bastard. [throws water in his face]

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Is all this true?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes, I’m afraid it is. You deserve much better than me Erica. You deserve to be with the real Drake, he’s the one you fell in love with. Go to Salem, find him, he’s the guy for you.

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: Oh Hans. [They kiss]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hans…Hans…Yo evil twin.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right. Goodbye Erica, good luck in Salem. Take care

content.speaker: Erica
content.text: I’ll never forget you Hans. [Joey shuts the door in her face]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: OK, alright, the people who threw the water.

content.description: Central Perk. Phoebe and Rob are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fired! Why?

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: The library board has had a lot of complaints from parents about some of the stuff in your songs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe it. Did you tell your board about how kids want to hear the truth?

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I see.

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: Maybe if you just played some regular kiddie songs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. What do you, what do you want me to be, like some stupid, big, like, purple dinosaur?

content.speaker: Rob
content.text: I’m not saying you have to be Barney.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Who’s Barney.

content.description: Central Perk. The whole gang is there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I tracked down Marcel and get this, he’s healthy, he’s happy, and he’s right here in New York filming Outbreak II - The Virus Takes Manhattan .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re kidding.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is amazing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I finally get a part on TV and the monkey’s makin’ movies.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, Rachel, I’m ready.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK.
[little kid enters]

content.speaker: Kid
content.text: Excuse me. Is this where the singing lady is that tells the truth?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, yeah I guess that’s me.

content.speaker: Kid
content.text: [shouting out the door] She’s here.
[a rush of kids enter]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [singing] Sometimes men love women, sometimes men love men, and then there are bisexuals, though some just say they’re kidding themselves. la la-la-la la-la-la-la-la-la-la…

content.description: City street. The whole gang is walking up to the movie set.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is so exciting, I haven’t seen my monkey in almost a year.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What, you never look down in the shower? Oh please. I’m not allowed to make one joke in the monkey-is-penis genre?

content.speaker: Security Guard
content.text: C’mon people, back up please, back up, c’mon, c’mon, c’mon, c’mon.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, excuse me, uh, where can we find the monkey?

content.speaker: Security Guard
content.text: I’m sorry guys, closed set.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, I’m sorry, you don’t understand, I’m, I’m, I’m a friend of his. We uh, we used to live together.

content.speaker: Security Guard
content.text: Yeah, and I have a time share in the Pocanos with Flipper.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, there he is.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, hey buddy, Marcel. Marcel. [Marcel doesn’t react so Ross starts singing] In the jungle, the mighty jungle the lion sleeps tonight. [no reaction from Marcel, Monica and Joey urge him on] In the jungle, the mighty jungle the lion sleeps tonight. [Marcel looks over and everyone joins in] a-weema-way, a-weema-way… [Marcel runs over and hops up on Ross’s shoulder]

content.description: The next time at the movie set.

content.speaker: Security Guard
content.text: Uh, excuse me folks this is a uhh…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Closed set. We know but we’re friends with the monkey. [guard lets them in]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good morning. Hey pal, look who I brought. It’s your old friend Harry Elefante. [Marcel grabs the elephant doll and throws it to the ground]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Woah, dude, burn.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t get it, he seemed so happy to see me yesterday.

content.speaker: Trainer
content.text: Hey don’t take it personal, he’s under a lot of pressure, ya know, starring in a movie and all.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now just how big of a star is Marcel?

content.speaker: Trainer
content.text: In human terms, I’d say Cybill Shepard.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Woah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [to guys wering yellow isolation suits] So, are you guys in the movie, or are you just really paranoid.

content.speaker: Director’s Assistant
content.text: Hey Sal, Jerry wants to know if the monkey’s ready for the subway set?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, excuse me. Jerry is the director, which one’s he?

content.speaker: Director’s Assistant
content.text: The one in the director’s chair.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Gotcha. Phoebs, walk with me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK. Um, how come I’m walking with you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, we’re, we’re just goin’ over here so that we can get away from the horrible flesh eating virus, for the love of God woman, listen to me. Is he lookin’, is he lookin’?

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: We’ve got a problem.

content.speaker: Director’s Assistant
content.text: Tell me.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: I can’t do Chris’s makeup. She refuses to acknowledge that she has a moustasche.

content.speaker: Director’s Assistant
content.text: Is it bad?

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: It looks like one of her eyebrows fell down. Now unless someone convinces her to let me bleach it, Jean-Claude Van Damme is gonna be making out with Gabe Kaplan.

content.speaker: Director’s Assistant
content.text: I’ll talk to her.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: I hate actors.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [to an extra in fatigues] Nice camoflauge man, for a minute there I almost didn’t see ya.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Excuse me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahhhh.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Uh, is your name Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, yes, yes it is.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Chandler Bing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you know me or are you just really good at this game?

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: I’m Susie Moss. Fourth grade, glasses, I used to carry around a box of animal crackers like a purse.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Susie Moss, right, yeah, wow, you look… great job growing up.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: It’s nice to see you’re not still wearing that denim cap with all the little mirrors on it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, right, well yeah, I graduated fourth grade and realized I wasn’t a pimp.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Remember the class play? You, you pulled up my skirt and the entire auditorium saw my underpants.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, back then I, uh, used humor as a defense mechanism. Thank God I don’t do that anymore.
[cut to Monica and Rachel walking through the set]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What what what what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Jean-Claude Van Damme. I didn’t know he was in this movie, he is so hot.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ya think?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The muscles from Brussels, wham bam Van Damme, did you see Time Cop ?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, was he any good in it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, he like, totally changed time.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow, so why don’t you go talk to him?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What, so you go over there, you tell him you think he’s cute, what’s the worst that could happen?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He could hear me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, I’m doin’ it for ya.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh Rachel don’t, don’t you dare, don’t, don’t . Tell him I cook.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Excuse me. Hi.

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um, this is gonna sound kinda goofy but uhhm, my friend over there, who cooks by the way, um, she thinks you’re cute.

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: You don’t think I’m cute?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I, I don’t know, um, do you think you’re cute? OK, we’re kinda gettin’ off the track here. Um, I was supposed to come here and tell you my friend thinks you’re cute. So what should I tell her?

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: You can tell her I think her friend is cute.
[back to Chandler and Susie]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, Stephen Hurs was the kid who would eat anything for money, David Stein was the guy who had no elbows.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: OK, well then who was the kid that got caught masturbating?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK that’s not what he was doing. Alright, he was looking for his bus money.
[a voice in the background calls for makeup]

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Oh that’s me, I gotta go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh uh, o, OK.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Um, so listen, how many times am I gonna have to touch you on the arm before you ask me on a date.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, uh, let’s try one more… there you go, say Ernie’s, 8 o’clock.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: I’ll be there, and who knows, if things go well, maybe this time I’ll get to see your underwear.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No one was around to hear that?
[back to Rachel and Monica]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So what’d he say?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Agh, what a jerk. I kept talking about you and he kept asking me out. I mean, naturally, you know, I said no.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, thanks anyway.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He just kept asking, and asking, and asking, and asking, and asking, and asking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel if you, if you want to go out with him, you can. Sound like a big jerk to me but if that’s what you want to do…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Jean-Claude she said yes, I’ll see you tonight. Thank you.

content.description: Central Perk. Joey and the girls are sitting at the couches.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And then Jean-Claude took me to that place Crossroads and that’s where we hung out with Drew Barrymore.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh man, she’s so smokin, she has got the greatest set of… no guys around, huh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Does anybody need anything?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I’ll have an espresso. Oh acutally, I’ll get it. If I ask you to, you’ll probably end up drinking it yourself.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is so unfair.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know. Oh, like you would drink her coffee after what you did to her with Van Damme.
[Ross enters]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Joey I have to cancel racketball for tonight, that was Marcel’s trainer. He’s gonna let me have him for a couple of hours.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re blowin’ me off for a monkey?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, we can rescedule for Saturday.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, unless you hook up with a bunch of pigeons.
[Chandler enters]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, stick a fork in me, I am done.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Stick a fork what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Like, when you’re cooking a steak.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, OK, I don’t eat meat.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well then, how do you know when vegetables are done?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well you know, you juist, you eat them and you can tell.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, then, eat me, I’m done.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ve met the perfect woman. OK, we’re sitting on her couch, we’re fooling around, and then suddenly she turns to me and says, ’do you ever want to do it in an elevator?’

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What did you say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahh, I believe my exact words were, ‘Flaign,en - sten’. I mean I didn’t know what to say, how do you know if you wanna do it on an elevator?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you just know.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Chandler and Susie are making out on the couch.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Oh, shoot, we gotta go, got a reservation in 30 minutes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no no no no, no no no no no no, you see, what I had planned shouldn’t take more that 2, 3 minutes tops.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Oh, 200 seconds of passion. We gotta go.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: But um, here’s an idea, have you ever worn women’s underwear?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, ye, yes, actually, but, uh, they were my Aunt Edna’s, and there were three of us in there.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Well I was thinking it would be um, kind of sexy if you wore mine tonight, at dinner.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You want me to wear your panties?

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Could ya?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, if I was wearing your underwear then, uh, what would you be wearing?… You’re swell.

content.description: Ross’s apartment. Ross is setting up for his time with Marcel. Joey is there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, got the music, got the dinner. Oh and check it out, I made Marcel’s favorite dish, banannacake.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oooh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: With mealworms.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yaaahhh. Ahhh, candles. What’dya thinks gonna happen here tonight?
[phone rings]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello. Oh hi, are you on your way ove-. Oh. No, no, I, I understand, I mean a monkey’s gotta work. No it, it’s no big deal, it’ not like I uh, had anything special planned. Yeah OK, OK. OK, OK, bye.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica and Rachel are upset with each other. Phoebe is mediating.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, Rachel, why don’t you start talking first.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright, I feel that this is totally unjustified. [Monica starts making faces behind her back] She gave me the green light, I did nothing but-. Do you think I can’t see you in the TV set?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright Monica, if there is something that you would like to share…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ya know, you had no right to go out with him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is the most ridiculous.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You sold me out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I did not sell you out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes you did. Absolutely.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Would you let me talk. [flicks Monica on the forehead]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you just flick me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, well, you wouldn’t let me finish and I was jus- [Monica flicks her back] Ow. That hurt [flicks Monica]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Quit flicking [flicks]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ow, you stop flicking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You flicked me first.
[They keep flicking each other. This turns into slapping each other. This leads to wrestling on the floor. All the while Phoebe is saying “Happy thoughts”. Eventually Phoebe gets fed up.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, now I’m gonna kick some ass.
[Phoebe grabs each of them by an ear]

content.speaker: Monica & Rachel
content.text: Ow. Ow. Ow.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, now I will let go if you both stop.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, what do you, you want me to stop seeing him, is that what you want?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You want me to just call him up and tell him that you’re seeing him instead? That’s what you want?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh that’s what you want.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fine,

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There we go.You know what, if we were in prison, you guys would be, like, my bitches.

content.description: A fancy restraunt (Marcel’s). Joey, Ross, Chandler, Susie, and the Director’s Assistant are there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks for letting me tag along tonight you guys.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Forget about it.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: How you doin there squirmy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m hangin in… and a little out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, assistant to the director. That’s a really exciting job, I mean, you must have a ton of cool responsibilities.

content.speaker: Director’s Assistant
content.text: I have nothing to do with casting.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So what’re you guys gonna eat?

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: How come all I can think about is putting that ice in my mouth and licking you all over?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because I went to an all boys high school and God is making up for it.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: I want you right here, right now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right now, right here. Don’t ya think we’re in kind of a public plaaaa [Susie grabs him under the table] They do have the shrimp.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Meet me in the bathroom. [she leaves for the bathroom]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m going to the bathroom now. [leaves for the bathroom]
[In the bathroom Susie and Chandler are kissing. She backs into a stall.]

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: C’mon.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe we’re doing this.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Alright mister, let’s see those panties.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alrighty. [we see Chandler’s pants drop from under the stall door]

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Ooh. Ooh. But ya know what would be even sexier?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: If you didn’t have your shirt tucked into them.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Alright. Now I would like to see you wearing nothing but them. Take your clothes off.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, but uh, I hope you realize this means we’re gonna miss hearing about the specials.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: C’mon hurry, hurry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, do you want this done quick, or do you want this done right?

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Alright, turn around. Time to see you from behind.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK.
[She turns him facing the toilet and sneaks out of the stall and gathers up his clothes.]

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Oh, somebody’s been doing his buns of steel video.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you want me to uh, clench anything, or-… Susie? Susie.

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: This is for the fourth grade.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Huh? Where, whaddya mean?

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Whaddo I mean. Whaddya mean, whaddo I mean? I mean underpants, mister, that’s what I mean.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What, what’s what you mean?

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: My skirt, you lifted, kids laughing. I was Susie Underpants ’till I was 18.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was in the fourth grade. How could you still be upset about that?

content.speaker: Susie
content.text: Well um, why don’t you call me in 20 years and tell me if you’re still upset about this. [she leaves with his clothes]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, I hope you realize you’re not getting these underpants back.

content.description: Monica and Van Damme are walking down the street.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe this, just like 2 weeks ago I was watching Sudden Death , now I’m on a date with Jean-Claude Van Damme. Can you beat up that guy? [he nods] Can you beat up that guy?

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is so wild. Ya know, I gotta admit, I was kinda surprised that you agreed to go on a blind date.

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: Normally, I would not do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, what made you make the exception for me?

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: ’Cause Rachel told me uh, you were dying to have a threesome with me and uh, Drew Barrymore. By the way, Drew has some groundrules and…

content.description: Back at Monica and Rachel’s apartment. They are now fighting about what Rachel told Van Damme.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Say you’re sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. [hitting each other]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Say it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. [hitting again]
[Monica grabs Rachel by the sweater. Rachel squirms out of it]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, you say you’re sorry or your sweater gets it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, OK, that is my favorite sweater, that is my third date sweater.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Say you’re sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, you wanna play? OK, let’s play, let’s play. [She grabs a jar of tomato sauce and Monica’s purse]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’re you gonna do?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You give me back my sweater or it’s handbag marinara.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You don’t have the guts.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah. Well, at least I wasn’t too chicken to tell some guy I thought he was cute.
[Monica pulls a thread on Rachel’s sweater and Rachel dumps the tomato sauce in Monica’s purse]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh alright, stop, STOP THE MADNESS . This is crazy. Who can even remember why this even started in the first place?
[Monica and Rachel start yelling at the same time]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes that’s right. But still, I-, look at your purse, look at your sweater, look at yourselves.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll help you fix your sweater.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll help you throw out your purse.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry that I made you stop seeing him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I’m sorry I went out with him when I knew you liked him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry that I borrowed your gloves [pulls Rachel’s gloves out of her purse]

content.description: Back at the restroom at Marcel’s. Chandler is still in the stall, Joey comes in to go to the bathroom.

content.text: [Joey starts whistling, Chandler finishes the tune. Joey whistles again.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ma?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler? What’re you still doin’ here, I though you guys took off.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, no no no, she took off with my clothes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you naked in there?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not exactly… I’m wearin panties.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh, you uh, you always wear panties?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, this is the first time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, talk about your bad luck, I mean, the first time you try panties and someone walks off with your clothes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I was not trying them out, Susie asked me to wear them.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, let me see.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. I’m not letting you or anybody else see, ever.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, alright. [climbs up in the next stall and looks over at Chandler] Woah, someone’s flossing.
[Ross enters, sees Joey in the mirror]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [to Joey who’s looking over a toilet stall] Joey, some people don’t like that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler’s wearing panties.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Let me see. [climbs up in the other adjoining stall]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, you don’t have to see.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi Tushie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, one of you give me your underpants.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can’t help you, I’m not wearing any.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How can you not be wearing any underwear?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I’m gettin’ heat from the guy in the hot pink thong.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright look Ross I’ll give you 50 dollars for your underpants.
[Some guy has entered.]

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi.
[Back at the table. Joey and Ross return. Shortly, Chandler comes out, holding the stall door in front of him, and leaves.]

content.description: Central Perk. Ross, Phoebe, and Chandler are sitting.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Phoebs, can I have the milk after you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m almost done with it, keep your panties on.
[Joey enters]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, hey, and I’m in the movie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: One of the virus victims called in sick, so Cathy recommended me and boom, I’m dying on the gurney. Oh Ross, Marcel just finished his last scene if you want to go down there and say goodbye.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahh, oh that’s OK, I mean, he’s probably got, you know, parties to go to and stuff. But, ya know, he’s moved on. Hey, that, that’s the way it goes right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [sees Marcel at the window] Oh my God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?
[“Looks Like We Made It” starts playing and we enter a whole sequence of Marcel and Ross having fun in the city.]

content.description: The movie set. Monica and Rachel are saying goodbye to Jean-Claude

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: [to Rachel] I’m sorry it didn’t work out between you and me, [to Monica] or you and me. Drew was very disappointed.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, well, bye. [kisses him]

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: Goodbye.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, bye for me too. [kisses him]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, well, bye-bye again. [kisses him again]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK.

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: Perhaps, uh, the three of us, just could…

content.speaker: Monica & Rachel
content.text: Oh, no no no no no.

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: Are you sure, I can crush a walnut with my butt.

content.speaker: Monica & Rachel
content.text: No no no no.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Impressive.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But no. Maybe if I were baking.

content.speaker: Monica & Rachel
content.text: Bye-bye.

content.description: City street. Whole gang is there seeing off Marcel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye Marcel. See ya on the big screen. You keep people drinkin’ that beer, OK. I miss you buddy.
[Marcel is driven off in a limo]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know, I think I want to write a song about all this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Oh, except one of the strings on my guitar is broken. Hey, Chandler, can I borrow your G-string?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How long you been waitin’ to say that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: About 20 minutes. CLOSING CREDITS

content.description: Filming a scene from the movie. Joey is dying on a gurney, Van Damme is looking over him.

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: Can’t you see what’s going on here, this man is dying.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aaaaagggghhhhh.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Cut.

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: Can’t you see what’s going on here, this man is dying.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aaaaagggghhhhh.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Cut.

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: Can’t you see what’s going on here, this man is dying.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aaaaagggghhhhh. Mommy

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Cut.

content.speaker: Van Damme
content.text: Can’t you see what’s going on here, this man is dead.
